Zicheng Pan

Research Fellow
Griffith University



About Me

I am a Research Fellow at Griffith University, Australia. I completed my PhD in Artificial Intelligence at Griffith University in May 2025, where my research focused on deep learning and computer vision. My particular interests lie in incremental learning, domain adaptation, fine-grained classification, and vision-language models. Prior to my doctoral studies, I earned a combined Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) and Master of Engineering in Electrical Engineering from the University of Queensland in 2021.

For more information, please visit my academic page. We are currently seeking highly motivated Ph.D. students to join our research group. If interested, please contact me with your CV. Scholarships may be available for qualified candidates.

Education
Griffith University 2022-2025

Doctor of Philosophy

Engaged in research at the ARC Research Hub for Driving Farming Productivity and Disease Prevention under the supervision of Prof. Yongsheng Gao and Dr. Xiaohan Yu. My work involves developing deep learning algorithms and models to advance computer vision applications in real-world agriculture scenarios.

The University of Queensland 2017-2021

Bachelor of Engineering (Hons) / Master of Engineering

Completed the degree in the Electrical Engineering field with First Class Honors.
